description: 1 x Pear (application T1) - Approximately 9.00m: Reduce crown height by approximately 2.00m. Reduce lateral and sub lateral growth by up to 1.20m. Remove dead wood throughout crown.1 x Purple Plum (applicants ref. T2) - Approximately 7.00m: Southern boundary with No.52. Thin crown density by 25%. Reduce crown by up to approximately 1.25m. Raise crown up to 1.50m to shape and help control dimensions.1 x Purple Plum (applicants ref. T3) - Approximately 8.00m: Overhanging pavement and road: Thin crown density by approximately 25%. Reduce crown by up to approximately 1.25m. Remove dead wood. Raise crown up to 1.50m.1 x Mature Hawthorn (applicants ref. T4) - Approximately 8.00m: Southern boundary: Reduce crown height by approximately 1.50m. Reduce lateral branch spread by approximately 1.25m to shape.1 x Field Maple (applicants ref. T5) - Approximately 11.00m: Thin crown density by approximately 20%. Shape crown by reducing branches by up to 1.50m back to suitable growth points. Remove dead wood.1 x Mature Birch (applicants ref. T6) - Approximately 9.00m: Thin crown density by approximately 10%. Reduce overlong extraneous branches back into main crown structure approximately 1.25m to promote a more compact form and crown line.1 x Mature Birch (applicants ref. T7) - Approximately 10.00m: Twin stemmed: Thin crown density by approximately 10%. Remove dead wood. Remove diseased stem if necessary.1 x Birch (applicants ref. T8) - Approximately 8.00m: Thin crown density by approximately 10%. Reduce overlong extraneous branches back into main crown structure to help shape and promote a compact form and crown line.Group of Conifers (applicants ref. G1) - Approximately 7.00m: Reduce height by approximately 1.00m-1.50m.
application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
